seg.input:
Wernhero suo gratiam precatur et pacem.
Mitto tibi, mi Wernhere, declamationes meas elapsas venus quam diligenter conscriptas. Dedico eas nomini tuo, liberum relinquens, num velis opus hoc, quod tu mihi quasi vi extorsisti, boni consulere. Quod ad me pertinet, non potui quicquam amico tam syncero ac bene faventi denegare; imo animus quidem maiora dedisset, modo licuisset per inopiam. Ceterum quod habemus, id damus. Vale in Christo. Salvum te volunt fratres universi, et tu omnes vicissim salutabis, quotquot Christi nomen induerunt.
Ex academia nostra Cappell, 8. calendas iulii anno ab incarnato Christo 1524.
Henrichus Bull[ingerus], tuus ex omni parte.
seg.output: I entreat your grace and peace, Wernhere. I send you my past discourses, which I carefully composed, dedicated to your name, leaving it to you whether you wish to approve of this work, which you almost extorted from me. As far as I am concerned, I could not deny anything to so sincere and kindly a friend; indeed, my spirit had been willing to give more, had it been possible owing to my poverty. However, we give what we have. Farewell in Christ. All the brethren wish you well, and you in turn will salute all those who have taken on the name of Christ. From our college at Cappell, on July 8th in the year of the incarnate Christ 1524. Henrichus Bull[ingerus], yours in every aspect.
